attributes.action: Demolish Baddington Railway Bridge near Nantwich and reinstate the A530
attributes.additional_details: This bridge became redundant in 1967. It’s ownership/management has been a long-standing point of delay/debate between Historic Railways Estate & Cheshire East Highways. Lack of maintenance/poor management has resulted in the road and embankments slumping excessively. For 20 years, traffic lights have reduced the structural loading. A recent 7.5T weight limit imposed on this arterial route is now causing significant issues with HGV’s/businesses attempting to avoid the bridge. It is not “listed”
attributes.background: We consider this issue time critical, a quick resolution to permanently demolish the bridge and reinstate the road is required.  Given the decades of delays and ineffective management leading to this point it is considered that Government/House of Commons support is required to expedite a solution.
